elements.title: the first known NBA player with sickle cell disease (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first known NBA player with sickle cell disease (pictured) once nearly died of a sickle cell crisis after a flight to a game?

elements.title: inner space (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the psychological inner space genre was a rebellion against the traditional focus of science fiction on literal outer space?

elements.title: Laufey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Billboard magazine, Laufey created a blueprint for jazz music in the modern music industry and helped push it back into the mainstream?

elements.title: PY Ta 641 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the tablet PY Ta 641 was instrumental in proving that Michael Ventris had indeed deciphered Linear B?

elements.title: Kenneth Raisbeck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite falling out with novelist Thomas Wolfe, Kenneth Raisbeck was the basis for a character in Of Time and the River?

elements.title: Allenbya collinsonae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that only one fruit but several thousand seeds were known when Allenbya collinsonae was named?

elements.title: Kelsey Lauritano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Kelsey Lauritano portrayed Mozart's Cherubino, a reviewer from the FAZ noted her "almost metallic-brittle approach that spreads androgynous infatuation"?

elements.title: Mildmay Mission Hospital (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mildmay Mission Hospital in East London is the only hospital in Europe specialising in the care and rehabilitation of people with HIV-associated neurocognitive disorder?

elements.title: Sukadji Hendrotomo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sukadji Hendrotomo's daughter solemnized her marriage contract in front of his deceased body?
